author: Justin Harp
title: James Cameron and Robert Rodriguez join forces for anime adaptation Battle Angel Alita - Movies
text: James Cameron's long-delayed live-action version of the groundbreaking anime Battle Angel Alita is finally a go - with Robert Rodriguez on board too.Cameron will produce and Rodriguez will direct the live-action project, which has been in various stages of development for over six years. © Getty Images / Gabriel Olsen Battle Angel Alita tells the story of a cyborg rescued from a scrap heap with no memories of her past life. Helpfully, Alita does remember her martial arts training - and is naturally put to work as a badass bounty hunter."Robert and I have been looking for a film to do together for years, so I was pumped when he said he wanted to do Battle Angel," Cameron announced today (October 15). "He's very collaborative and we're already like two kids building a go-kart, just having fun riffing creatively and technically. "This project is near and dear to me, and there's nobody I trust more than Robert, with his technical virtuosity and rebel style, to take over the directing reins. "We're looking forward to learning a lot from each other while we make a kick-ass epic."For his part, veteran director Rodriguez touted the chance to work with three-time Oscar winner James Cameron as a learning experience. © Twitter/Robert RodriguezCharlie Sheen with Robert Rodriguez "Getting to work from Jim's terrific and visionary script while learning the cutting edge techniques he's pioneered is a master class in filmmaking," Rodriguez said. "It's an honour to explore the world of Alita along with Jim and Jon, whose films have impacted me for decades."Battle Angel Alita was released as a manga series back in 1990, with its popularity leading to a variety of spinoffs.The live-action Battle Angel Alita was initially conceived as a directorial project for Cameron, who is now busy with the Avatar sequels.Robert Rodriguez is currently working on the television spinoff of his From Dusk till Dawn movie, and also recently debuted the action-packed music video for Demi Lovato's single 'Confident'.
